Package com.example.backend.controller

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
com.example.backend.controller.UserController
@CrossOrigin(origins={"http://localhost:3000","http://localhost:5173"}) @RestController @RequestMapping(path="/user") public class UserController extends Object
The UserController class serves as the controller for handling all HTTP requests involving User objects. This class utilizes both UserService and FlightService for performing database operations and returning data to the client. It handles CORS requests from specified local addresses. The class is marked with the @Slf4j annotation which provides logging through the logback library. Authentication is additionally secured by the @AdditionalAuthentication annotation.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserController

      @Autowired public UserController(UserService userService, FlightService flightService)
      The UserController constructor which is autowired by Spring (via the @Autowired annotation) to provide an instance of UserService and FlightService.
      Parameters:
      userService - The service that handles operations related to User objects.
      flightService - The service that handles operations related to Flight objects.

  • Method Details

    • getUsers

      @GetMapping public Set<UserDto> getUsers()
      The getUsers method returns a set of UserDto objects. The method is mapped to GET requests at "/user".
      Returns:
      A set of UserDto objects.

    • getUser

      @GetMapping(path="{userId}") public UserDto getUser(@PathVariable("userId") Long userId)
      The getUser method returns a single UserDto object based on a provided userId. The method is mapped to GET requests at "/user/{userId}".
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the User to be fetched.
      Returns:
      A single UserDto object.

    • createUser

      @PostMapping public void createUser(@RequestBody User user)
      The createUser method creates a new user. The method is mapped to POST requests at "/user".
      Parameters:
      user - The User object to be created.

    • deleteUser

      @DeleteMapping(path="{userId}") public void deleteUser(@PathVariable("userId") Long userId)
      The deleteUser method deletes a user based on a provided userId. The method is mapped to DELETE requests at "/user/{userId}".
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the User to be deleted.

    • updateUser

      @PutMapping(path="{userId}") public void updateUser(@PathVariable("userId") Long userId, @RequestBody User user)
      The updateUser method updates a user based on a provided userId. The method is mapped to PUT requests at "/user/{userId}".
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the User to be updated.
      user - The updated User object.

    • getUserHistory

      @GetMapping(path="/flights_history/{userId}") public Collection<Flight> getUserHistory(@PathVariable("userId") Long userId)
      The getUserHistory method fetches a collection of flights that a user has flown. The method is mapped to GET requests at "/user/flights_history/{userId}".
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the User whose flight history is to be fetched.
      Returns:
      A Collection of Flight objects.

    • addMessage

      @PostMapping(path="/add_message") public void addMessage(@RequestBody Map<String,Object> requestBody)
      The addMessage method adds a message for a specific user. The method is mapped to POST requests at "/user/add_message".
      Parameters:
      requestBody - The request body containing a userId and a message.

    • madeReservation

      @PostMapping(path="/made_reservation") public void madeReservation(@RequestBody Map<String,Object> requestBody)
      The madeReservation method makes a reservation for a user on a specific flight. The method is mapped to POST requests at "/user/made_reservation".
      Parameters:
      requestBody - The request body containing a userId and a flightId.

    • cancelReservation

      @PostMapping(path="/cancel_reservation") public void cancelReservation(@RequestBody Map<String,Object> requestBody)
      The cancelReservation method cancels a user's reservation for a flight. The method is mapped to POST requests at "/user/cancel_reservation".
      Parameters:
      requestBody - The request body containing a userId and a flightId.
